Crimes.Crime_Name: Misrepresentation under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant's religious conversion and sincerity of belief
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant lacked credibility due to prior fraud and inability to recall basic religious details
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Testimony, prior visa application records, lack of evidence of religious practice
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 2(1) IRPA - definition of Convention refugee; Section 96-97 IRPA - basis for refugee protection claims
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Prior fraudulent visa application and inconsistencies in testimony
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Provided false information in previous visa application
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None noted – Board considered all available evidence
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board’s credibility findings were reasonable
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility regarding religious conversion and history of fraud
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 108, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (misrepresentation)
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent testimony, lack of documentary proof of religious practice
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process followed procedural fairness in assessment
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Fraudulent student visa application submitted previously
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Applicant could not recall key religious dates and had prior dishonesty
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant challenged reasonableness of Board's decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review of administrative decisions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to provide consistent and credible testimony

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant's religious claims in light of prior visa fraud
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board questioned authenticity of religious conversion due to inconsistent statements and lack of evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Prior visa application, testimony about religious practices in China and Canada
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Religious persecution claim based on alleged Christian faith
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Prior fraudulent visa application and lack of credible evidence of religious practice
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Submitted false documents or statements in student visa application
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None identified – Board assessed all relevant evidence
Crimes.Application_Factor: History of immigration fraud impacting credibility
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board reasonably assessed credibility
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility concerns arising from fraudulent visa application and inconsistent testimony
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration for religious practice in home country or Canada
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Fair process followed by the Board
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Submission of false information in student visa application
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony and lack of detail about religious beliefs
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Applicant argued Board unreasonably dismissed claim
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review of administrative tribunal decisions
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to substantiate religious practice with credible evidence
